name: Housing Counseling Assistance Program
objective: Provide funds to HUD-approved housing counseling agencies that provide counseling and advice to tenants and homeowners, with respect to property maintenance, financial management and literacy, and other matters as may be appropriate to assist program clients in improving their housing conditions, meeting their financial needs, and fulfilling the responsibilities of tenancy or homeownership.
top_agency_name: Department of Housing and Urban Development
sub_agency_name: Assistant Secretary for Housing -- Federal Housing Commissioner
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals
Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)
State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: Housing and Urban Development Act of 1968 (12 U.S.C 1701x), 214, 106, Housing and Urban Development Act of 1968, as amended.
